intro: Agalinis kingsii, commonly known as the Kings' bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Agalinis kingsii is considered a short-lived perennial and plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
